alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 8:28AM CST until January 20 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water begins to inundate agricultural land and other low lying areas along the river including access points from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 17.2 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CST.
